eligibility: Indian citizen, age 20-25 years (relaxation for reserved categories), Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university, must meet prescribed physical and medical standards[1][3][4].
duration: 5 hours (2 hours for Paper 1, 3 hours for Paper 2)
negativeMarking: One-third marks deducted for each incorrect answer in Paper 1[3].
coursesLinked: Recruitment as Assistant Commandant in BSF, CRPF, CISF, ITBP, SSB

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for the UPSC CAPF exam?
faqs.answer: Candidates must be Indian citizens aged 20-25 years (relaxation for reserved categories), possess a Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university, and meet the prescribed physical and medical standards[1][3][4].
